page.title: 16The Hamlet of West Dean
page.content: The small hamlet of West Dean seems to offer its inhabitants a high degree of contentment and satisfaction with the quality of their lives in 1985.We spoke to a number of people whose ages ranged from 12 to 80 years and were struck by their lack of concern over the limited range of amenities available in their immediate vicinity. A community bus operates a twice a week service to the nearby town of Seaford;there are two daily postal collections.Delivery of milk is made but no van delivery of other foods.The nearest doctor is in Alfriston (about 3 miles away) and no library service exists in West Dean.People valued more highly than amenities the sense of being much more alive than when they lived in more suburban surroundings. The level of community concern for neighbours seems high.
